section.p: Memory devices (ex. DRAM, SODIMM) can radiate broadband and narrowband RFI noise and may cause radio frequency interference. A combination of EMI shield and antenna placement is required to mitigate noise from memory devices.
SODIMM memory devices can cause higher RFI noise than the soldered down DRAM devices and it is highly recommended to use an EMI shield for the SODIMM memory devices.
Refer to the sections “On-Board Shielding” and “Intel DDR RFI Mitigation (RFIM) Software Feature” for more information.
